alert.note: Alert for Flathead, Mission Valleys; Lower Clark Fork Region; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Missoula, south central Lake and southeastern Sanders Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 429 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near St. Ignatius, or 27 miles north of Missoula, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half-inch size hail. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ravalli, St. Ignatius, Arlee and Moiese. This includes the following highways... Highway 93 N between mile markers 17 and 36. Highway 200 W between mile markers 111 and 115. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Flathead, Mission Valleys; Lower Clark Fork Region; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region
